stem.name: actually
stem.definition: in reality, the following is true

stem.name: already
stem.definition: action or state completed before speaker-time

stem.name: also
stem.definition: to do something in addition to what was already stated

stem.name: also
stem.definition: an attribute applies here as well (he is also tall)

stem.name: also
stem.definition: to do something that somebody else did (I also did it.) (modifies nouns)

stem.name: always
stem.definition: the state will always be true

stem.name: badly
stem.definition: to do something in a bad or incorrect manner

stem.name: bravely
stem.definition: to do something that is dangerous or difficult with courage and confidence, without fear (John climbed the tall tree bravely.)

stem.name: completely
stem.definition: the event must be done completely

stem.name: cruelly
stem.definition: in a way that causes emotional or physical pain

stem.name: eagerly
stem.definition: to really want to do something, to do it with excitement (John eagerly read the report.)

stem.name: even
stem.definition: emphasizes that even the event did/should or did/should not occur

stem.name: finally
stem.definition: the event was done last in a series of events

stem.name: first
stem.definition: the event done first (he first went to the store)

stem.name: gently
stem.definition: to do something carefully in order to not hurt someone

stem.name: greatly
stem.definition: the event is done to the extreme

stem.name: happily
stem.definition: to do something with happiness, joy

stem.name: how
stem.definition: a question word - (how did you do something)

stem.name: how-long
stem.definition: question word asking for length of time

stem.name: joyfully
stem.definition: the event was done with joy

stem.name: little
stem.definition: to do something only a small amount, or to a small degree

stem.name: long
stem.definition: the duration of an event is long (he worked long)

stem.name: more
stem.definition: the event is done to a greater degree (you will believe more)

stem.name: most
stem.definition: to do this event more than any other event

stem.name: much
stem.definition: an event is done often or to a great degree

stem.name: peacefully
stem.definition: to do something peacefully, without fighting

stem.name: perhaps
stem.definition: maybe, possibly (Perhaps Mary read that book.)

stem.name: recently
stem.definition: in the recent past, a little while ago

stem.name: repeatedly
stem.definition: an action is performed many times

stem.name: sensibly
stem.definition: to act/think/behave in a manner that shows good judgment

stem.name: sincerely
stem.definition: to do something sincerely, from the heart

stem.name: successfully
stem.definition: to do something that you tried to do (The doctor successfully treated the patient.)

stem.name: suddenly
stem.definition: the event happened qickly and with little warning

stem.name: truly
stem.definition: to really do something, as opposed to faking or lying about it
